title.narrative: Life After Fast Fashion? ? Just Transition in Asia?s Clothing and Textile Industry
Mita pikamuodin jalkeen? ? Oikeudenmukainen siirtyma Aasian vaate- ja tekstiiliteollisuudessa

description.narrative: The climate crisis consumer activism and increasing corporate social responsibility regulation are pushing the textile- and clothing industry to renew itself. The industry must move from throw-away culture to circular economy tackle emissions from raw mate rials and manufacturing and ensure a just transition to developing country workers dependent on fast fashion. ?Life After Fast Fashion?? -project promotes the textile and clothing industry?s move towards carbon-free business while at the same time supporti ng just transition in Asia?s manufacturing countries. This will be achieved by influencing industry practices encouraging consumers to take action and strengthening the voice of developing country workers and their representative trade unions in the discus sion about the future of the industry. The target groups of the project are key personnel in textile and clothing companies Finnish citizens interested in responsible consumption and trade union activists. By producing new research on just transition in th e framework of corporate social responsibility engaging in dialogue with companies and creating a training- and communications package the project encourages the textile and clothing industry to take just transition into account in its climate actions. Dia logue with companies will be supported by awareness-raising among consumers. The project will create communications material about the climate actions needed in the textile and clothing industry and related human rights impacts. The project will cooperate with social media influencers and encourage consumers to take action in social media campaigns targeting the industry. Developing country perspectives will be highlighted with research into the wishes and hopes of workers and their representative trade un ions for the future of the industry in the context of climate crisis. The project will produce communications material in developing countries and cooperate with the Finnish trade union movement.
